SEARCH
Package db_conn

Class Requests

java.lang.Object
db_conn.Requests
public class Requests extends Object
A utility class (non-instantiable) which provides the methods that are callable from the frontend.

All request string have to be of the format <"r"/"w">&<methodName>&<Arg1>;<Arg2>;.... The units for the request type, method name and arguments are separated by &. Arguments for the callable method <methodName> are separated by ;.

  • Method Details

    • addBookFromIsbn

      public static int addBookFromIsbn(String isbn) throws SQLException, IOException, URISyntaxException
      Add a book to the library from a provided ISBN. Further book informations will by automatically added.
      Parameters:
      isbn - the isbn of the book to be added
      Returns:
      status code '0' if the execution was successful
      Throws:
      SQLException - if something went wrong in the execution of the SQL query
      IOException
      URISyntaxException

    • addBookManually

      public static int addBookManually(String title, String author, String isbn) throws SQLException
      Add a book to the library by providing all informations manually.
      Parameters:
      title - title of the book to be added
      author - author of the book to be added
      isbn - isbn (isbn-10 or isbn-13) of the book to be added
      Returns:
      status code '0' if the execution was successful
      Throws:
      SQLException - if something went wrong in the execution of the SQL query

    • recBooks

      public static int recBooks(String props) throws SQLException
      Receive the `Books` table from the database. The props member determines which columns of the Books table are returned. Within the String, the column names are supposed to be comma-separated in the order in which they should be displayed. The following column names are allowed
      • isbn
      • author
      • title
      • quantity
      • borrowed
      • borrower_id
      Parameters:
      props - formatted string of column names
      Returns:
      status code '0' if the execution was successful
      Throws:
      SQLException - if something went wrong in the execution of the SQL query
